_header: Rich and poor young and old
_description: A single stanza (No. 47 of the Oxford, Bodleian Library Digby 86 (SC 1687) text) of the Proverbs of Hendyng, sometimes embedded in the Latin prose Summa de vii viciis of Thomas Aquinas — six lines.

BLRoy8Exvii.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             A Register of Middle English Religious & Didactic Verse.
         2 vols. London: Oxford University Press for the Bibliographical
            Society: 1916-20: 1.362.

NLS18721.Transcription:
Riche & pore ȝung & oldÞerquiles ȝe hauen
                    ȝure with in wo[de]Seket soule boteFor wan ȝe wenen
                    alþerbestTo hauen helþe pes an restÞe ex is at þe
                    rote

DurCathBI18.Transcription:
Riche and pouer yunge and haldeto qwiles þu haueste þi wit
                    in waldeþu seth þi saule botefor wane þu wenest alle yn
                    bestblisse and hele ro and restþe ax is at þe
                    rote
DurCathBI18.Note:
In the Latin prose Summa de vii viciis of Thomas
                    Aquinas.
